广告牌 https://www.billboard.com音乐排行榜、新闻、照片和视频2023 年 9 月 7 日星期四 16:15:30 +0000 en-US每小时1 https://wordpress.org/?v=6.2.2 安吉米利如何通过《国王》将黑人变性人的愤怒变成他的代表作https://www.billboard.com/culture/pride/anjimile-the-king-black-trans-rage-1235407211/Stephen Daw Thu, 07 Sep 2023 16:15:25 +0000 CulturePrideMusic Newspriderock https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235407211 The singer songwriter breaks down his new album, and how the murder of George Floyd in 2020 opened a floodgate for his righteous fury.

从表面上看，安吉米尔·奇坦博似乎是一个相当悠闲、和蔼可亲的人。这位歌手兼作曲家步行到布鲁克林克林顿山附近的一家咖啡馆，漫不经心地注意到温暖的天气，用猫般的反应来转移赞美（“我真的不擅长接受任何积极的强化，”他开玩笑），并表达了轻微的担忧他的第二张专辑的发行。

2023年9月7日

“我选择了一份卖日记的工作，”他们苦笑着说道，在一家稀疏的咖啡馆里的一张桌子旁坐下。 “当我要卖掉我的日记时，我会想，‘哦，不，人们会读它的。’”因此，对于做我按照合同规定必须做的事情，我会产生一种不必要的焦虑。”

然而，如果人们对这位新兴独立艺术家的唯一了解是他们的最新专辑，那么他们会看到一个与在布鲁克林海军造船厂对面喝着冰茶的人截然不同的人。

在Anjimile的第二张专辑《The King》 （9 月 8 日星期五通过 4AD 发行）中，这位 30 岁的艺术家向一个拒绝让他按自己的方式生活的世界释放出一股愤怒、沮丧、不适和愤慨。这张专辑充满了凄凉的意象和痛苦的观点，要求观众思考；像安吉米尔这样的人应该如何在我们建立的文化中生存？

创作《国王》的歌曲是关于安吉米尔给自己空间来悲伤和处理他们作为黑人非二元跨性别者所面临的无数斗争（安吉米尔使用他/他们代词）。这一艰难的过程很大程度上是由于2020年乔治·弗洛伊德被谋杀，以及该视频疯传后爆发的针对警察暴行的抗议活动。安吉迈尔说，看到这种不公正行为继续不受制止，他内心深处涌起一股深深的愤怒，他试图找到任何可以发泄的方式来释放压抑的情绪。

它是从聆听其他艺术家的声音开始的。 “我制作了一个名为“Black”的播放列表，其中只是黑人艺术家的一堆抗议歌曲——Anderson .Paak 的“ King James ”、Fela Kuti 的“ Zombie ”、Nina Simone 的“ Mississippi Goddam ”、Nina Simone 的“ Alright ”肯德里克·拉马尔，”他们说。 “现在，不幸的是，每当有新的[有关警察暴行的故事]时，我都会播放该播放列表。”

这最终帮助安吉米尔表达了他的感受，在弗洛伊德死后的三天里，他写了三首歌，这些歌曲后来成为《国王》的核心歌曲：“创世纪”，一首在不可能的情况下悲伤的受伤民谣，“对，”对恐惧的令人难以忘怀的描述，以及“动物”，一首激动人心的抗议歌曲，大胆地宣称“如果你像动物一样对待我/我就会成为动物。”

艺术家安吉米尔的严肃与人安吉米尔的平静之间的分歧很大程度上是有意设计的。 “不管你信不信，我很难表达自己的感受，除非通过歌曲，”他一边喝着酒，一边平静地解释道。 “我一直用音乐作为宣泄口，促使我审视自己的感受，学习如何感受它们，然后表达它们。因为否则我不会做这样的事。”

也许这张专辑中最具影响力的歌曲来自它的同名歌曲。在《国王》中，安吉米尔讲述了巴比伦国王伯沙撒的圣经故事，他看到一只手在宫殿的墙上写下了一条他无法翻译的信息。伯沙撒请但以理解释这条信息，结果发现他“被权衡了，发现有不足之处”。当歌曲中透露出这一信息时，一阵旋风般的声音和敲击的吉他弦在听众周围旋转，安吉迈尔发出了咒语； “我们这一年的瘟疫/黑死病来了……有一股火焰/它呼唤着你的名字。”

这首歌的歌词灵感来自安吉米尔多年前与父亲的一次谈话。安吉迈尔正与酗酒作斗争，他们的父亲找到了他们，告诉他们“不祥之兆”的故事。故事结束后，他们没有得到任何解释或寓意——他们的父亲只是告诉他们“考虑一下”。

多年后，即使在个人生活中清醒并找到平静之后，安吉米尔仍然发现自己在思考那个故事。 “我认为它一直困扰着我，因为它非常可怕。一只无形的手出现了，只是在墙上写着什么？那是一部恐怖电影，”他说。 “直到我写这首歌时，我才觉得自己明白了重点——我在思考警察的暴行和杀手警察，并希望看到有人得到权衡并发现不足。这几乎成了一种复仇幻想，我最终乞求某种惩罚性正义。”

Anjimile 指出，由于 2020 年他们所写内容的动荡本质，他们并不急于重新审视这个顶空。 “这很痛苦，”他们说。 “当然，这确实是一种宣泄，因为我从来没有真正去过那个地方，我觉得我能够认真处理一些我很难面对的情绪。但这对我来说确实很难。”

经过几个月的时间通过歌曲创作探索他的心灵深处，安吉米尔留下了几十首代表他全部挫败感的歌曲。他将注意力重新转移到了自己的事业上——他即将发行首张专辑《Giver Taker》 ，该专辑反思了他的出柜历程，并通过更阳光、更乐观的声音展现了他与清醒的斗争。

直到 2021 年底与 4AD 签约后不久与经纪人会面，Anjimile 才意识到他对 2020 年夏天的反思可以制作出一张很好的概念专辑。 “可以这么说，我把所有这些曲子都放在烤箱里了。 [我的经理]就像是，‘嘿——把它们做成一张专辑，’”他说。

因此，Anjimile 开始选择合适的歌曲加入该项目，并选择合适的制作人来帮助将它们打造成一个有凝聚力的作品。在洛杉矶进行了六天的“制片人快速约会”后，安吉米尔找到了肖恩·埃弗雷特。 “老实说，肖恩是我的梦中情人，”他温柔地微笑着说道。

安吉米尔回忆起在他家中与制作人见面的情景，他与埃弗雷特聊了几个小时，谈论“音乐，但也不是音乐”，见到了他的家人，一起去了当地的一家餐馆，并立即一拍即合。经过一周的愉快约会后，安吉米尔终于找到了一位创意合作伙伴，他知道他可以让《国王》变得伟大。

埃弗里特要求安吉米尔做的第一件事就是和他一起参观一系列艺术博物馆，并挑选一幅不同的画来代表专辑中的每首歌。对于这位艺术家来说，这是一次奇怪的练习，但他说，这一练习最终为专辑带来了重大成果。 “这些图像为我们提供了一个非常强大的工作焦点，”他说。 “有了这些，我们就可以对歌曲进行旋转并使它们适合。它最终成为一张非常具有视觉动机的专辑。”

有了他们的参考资料和选择编排和录制的十首歌曲，安吉米尔和埃弗雷特开始制作《国王》 。这被证明是这张专辑中最引人注目的创意选择之一，两人决定只使用两种乐器录制整张专辑——安吉米尔的声音和原声吉他。

这并不是说《The King》是典型的原声专辑——在整个 LP 中，Everett 和 Anjimile 充分利用了他们限制使用的两种乐器，找到了越来越创新的方法来复制鼓、弦乐、羽管键琴和钢琴的声音。无论他们觉得什么其他乐器都会增加专辑的不祥感。

“对我来说，真正能激发创造性的东西就是限制，”他们说。 “这不仅让人感觉是一个令人兴奋的限制，而且还有助于为专辑提供一种声音凝聚力。如果你愿意的话，感觉就像一个完整的调色板。”

实行这种限制过程意味着为问题本身创造出奇怪的解决方案。有一次让安吉迈尔大笑起来，他们俩想创作一首险恶的、地下的背景音乐来渗透到歌曲《母亲》中。 Anjimile 咯咯地笑着解释了他们为捕捉声音而创建的录音装置：“那个背景音轨是我最初的声乐和原声吉他演示，从扬声器中出来，并由浸入一壶水的麦克风重新录制。套上安全套，”他们说，咯咯笑变成了放声大笑。 “这有什么意义吗？”

尽管安吉米尔花了三年时间编写、编曲、录制和制作《国王》 ，但他仍然对这个项目的及时性感到震惊。据《华盛顿邮报》数据显示，过去12个月里，警方枪杀了近1000人。 1 月，孟菲斯警方在一次交通堵塞后殴打 29 岁的泰尔·尼科尔斯 (Tire Nichols)约三分钟；他后来因冲突中受伤而死亡。与此同时，跨性别群体已成为美国反LGBTQ立法最热门的目标，数十个州立法机构提出甚至通过了限制跨性别者获得最佳实践医疗服务、 歧视跨性别学生、阻止跨性别者的法律。 能够使用他们选择的浴室等等。

“我没有看到反跨性别立法会取得成功，”安吉米尔疲惫地叹了口气说道。 “我很震惊，但我认为我不应该如此。当这些开始过去时，我感到非常天真。我只是想到所有那些不能住在父母家之外的酷儿年轻人，他们现在甚至不能在学校使用自己的名字……这让我真的很担心。”

这种担忧就是为什么安吉米尔希望黑人跨性别者聆听《国王》 ，以便他们能够体验到他在写作时所经历的同样的宣泄。 “我知道这是一张非常激烈的唱片，表达了很多愤怒、绝望和恐惧，”他说。 “但是当我写这些歌曲时，他们能够引导和释放那些具有挑战性的感觉。我希望人们能够亲身体验这一点。”

; 奥利弗·安东尼 (Oliver Anthony) 加入 Louder Than Life 阵容进行两场演出https://www.billboard.com/music/country/oliver-anthony-louder-than-life-festival-lineup-1235408241/Jessica Nicholson Thu, 07 Sep 2023 16:15:01 +0000 CountryMusicfestivalsLouder Than LifeMusic Newsrock https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235408241 The music festival will also feature Green Day and Foo Fighters.

Green Day、Foo Fighters、Run The Jewels、Godsmack ……还有奥利弗·安东尼？这位《里士满北部的富人》热门制作人计划在即将于 9 月 21 日至 24 日在肯塔基州路易斯维尔肯塔基展览中心的高地音乐节场地举行的 Louder Than Life 音乐节上表演两场。

安东尼（真名是 Christopher Lunsford）将于 9 月 21 日和 22 日在 Kroger Big Bourbon Bar 进行两场演出。安东尼订婚的具体时间将在各自的演出日公布。音乐节阵容中的其他艺术家包括 Weezer、Avenged Sevenfold、Tool、Rancid、AWOLNation、Flagging Molly、Megadeth 和 Corey Taylor。

奥利弗·安东尼 (Oliver Anthony) 以声学方式镇压贪婪政客的作品《里士满北部的富人》最近引起了轰动。在 8 月 26 日的Billboard Hot 100排行榜上，这首歌飙升至第一名，标志着他首次出现在排行榜上，这位艺术家成为第一位在之前从未出现过的排行榜上首次登上 Hot 100 排行榜第一名的歌手。任何形式。

《Rich Men North of Richmond》也是第一首同时登上热门 100 和热门乡村歌曲排行榜第一名的男性独唱歌曲。唯一一首做到这一点的歌曲是斯威夫特 2021 年的《All Too Well（泰勒版）》。

与此同时，安东尼的其他几首歌曲——比如“Ain't Gotta Dollar”、“90 Some Chevy”和“I Want to Go Home”——也赢得了稳定的流媒体播放量。

他还计划在今年年底举办其他一些音乐节演出，包括蓝岭摇滚音乐节（9 月 8 日至 9 日）、罂粟山音乐节（9 月 14 日）和 Alley Fest（10 月 6 日）。

; 奥利维亚·罗德里戈 (Olivia Rodrigo) 将在 2023 年视频音乐奖上表演https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/olivia-rodrigo-perform-2023-video-music-awards-1235407969/Paul Grein Thu, 07 Sep 2023 16:00:00 +0000 AwardsMusicMTV Video Music AwardsMTV VMAs https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235407969 Rodrigo had a memorable night at the VMAs two years ago when she performed “Good 4 U” and won three awards.

奥利维亚·罗德里戈 (Olivia Rodrigo)将于美国东部时间/太平洋时间 9 月 12 日星期二晚上 8 点在新泽西州纽瓦克保德信中心 (Prudential Center) 现场表演 2023 年 MTV 音乐录影带大奖。

两年前，罗德里戈在 VMA 度过了一个难忘的夜晚。她表演了《Good 4 U》并获得了三个奖项，这使她与 BTS 和 Lil Nas X 并列当晚获得最多奖项的奖项。她赢得了最佳新人奖以及《Drivers License》年度歌曲和年度 PUSH 表演两项大奖。

以下是 2023 年 MTV 音乐录影带大奖的所有表演者和主持人（更新中）

2023年9月7日

罗德里戈今年获得了 6 项 VMA 提名，全都是《Vampire》提名，这首歌在 7 月成为她第三支单曲（继《Drivers License》和《Good 4 U》之后）进入Billboard Hot 100位居第一。《Vampire》上升了年度视频、年度歌曲、最佳流行音乐、夏季歌曲、最佳摄影和最佳剪辑。

罗德里戈正是预订今年 VMA 所需的那种主流流行巨星。就服务该节目的目标观众而言，她和Doja Cat可能是 9 月 12 日节目迄今为止最好的“收获”。表演者阵容还包括 Anitta、Demi Lovato、Karol G、Kelsea Ballerini、Lil Wayne、Måneskin、Sean “Diddy” Combs、Shakira、Stray Kids 和 TOMORROW X TOGETHER。尽管演出即将开始，MTV 表示更多表演者仍有待公布。

夏奇拉将获得 MTV 视频先锋奖，并自 2006 年以来首次在节目中现场表演。吹牛老爹将获得全球偶像奖，并自 2005 年以来首次在节目中现场表演。

Rodrigo 的第二张专辑《Guts》定于周五（9 月 8 日）发行，距离 VMA 仅有四天。她的首张专辑《 Sour》在 2021 年Billboard 200排行榜上连续五周排名第一。

年仅 20 岁的罗德里戈是 Hot 100 历史上最年轻的拥有三首单曲进入排行榜第一名的艺人。她也是第一位凭借两张职业生涯开场专辑中的主打单曲登上 Hot 100 榜首的艺人。

加上社交类别，泰勒·斯威夫特 (Taylor Swift) 在 2023 年 VMA 的所有提名者中以 11 项提名领先，其次是 SZA（8 项）； BLACKPINK、Doja Cat、Miley Cyrus、Nicki Minaj 和 Rodrigo（各六人）； Kim Petras 和 Sam Smith（各 5 名）；以及 Beyoncé、Diddy、Drake、Ice Spice、Karol G、Metro Boomin、Shakira 和 TOMORROW X TOGETHER（各四人）。

普通粉丝投票现已结束；社会类别和最佳新艺术家的投票仍然开放。

Bruce Gillmer 和 Den of Thieves 联合创始人 Jesse Ignjatovic 是 2023 年 MTV 音乐录影带大奖的执行制作人。巴布·拜尔科斯基 (Barb Bialkowski) 担任联合执行制片人。艾丽西亚·葡萄牙和杰基·巴尔巴担任负责制作的高管。温迪·普劳特 (Wendy Plaut) 是负责名人人才的高管。丽莎·劳里塞拉 (Lisa Lauricella) 是音乐人才主管。

; 扎克·布莱恩凹凸：战争与条约、凯西·马斯格雷夫斯等人在新专辑中亮相https://www.billboard.com/pro/zach-bryan-streaming-gains-the-war-and-treaty-kacey-musgraves/Andrew Unterberger Thu, 07 Sep 2023 15:50:38 +0000 Chart BeatMusicTrending Up https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235408181 This week on 'Trending Up,' Bryan's self-titled success leads to streaming gains for his guests, plus an old Rihanna hit revived on TikTok.

欢迎来到 Billboard Pro 的“流行趋势”专栏，在这里我们将仔细研究引起音乐行业关注的歌曲、艺术家、新奇事物和趋势。有些是凭空出现的，有些是花了几个月的时间才流行起来的，而所有这些都可能在 TikTok 视频的眨眼间变得无处不在。

本周：扎克·布莱恩 (Zach Bryan) 最新大片 LP 的嘉宾们在自己的直播中看到了收获，而一场舞蹈挑战让蕾哈娜 (Rihanna) 的几首“小”热门歌曲之一复活，而一位冉冉升起的南非艺术家则迎来了突破时刻。

《战争与条约》从扎克·布莱恩·邦普(Zach Bryan Bump) 中获得最大收益

您可能听说过，扎克·布莱恩 (Zach Bryan)统治了本周的Billboard排行榜（日期为 9 月 9 日），他的同名专辑击败了Billboard 200 ，而该系列的主打单曲“I Remember Everything”首次登上Billboard Hot 100榜首 —他在两个排行榜上都首次排名第一。这首歌由格莱美奖获得者兼作曲家凯西·马斯格雷夫斯 (Kacey Musgraves) 演唱，她是该片场的四位客座艺术家之一，在专辑发行后的一周，他们都出现在美国官方点播节目中。

Musgraves 和其他明星嘉宾 Lumineers 都看到了他们的作品在流媒体上的小幅增长——根据 Luminate 的数据，分别增长了 8% 至 620 万和 5% 至 1840 万——而 Sierra Ferrell 的作品仅增长了 2%。但扎克·布莱恩 (Zach Bryan)的最大受益者无疑是美国二人组《战争与条约》(The War and Treaties)，在出现在片场的“Hey Driver”（这也是该专辑在 Hot 100 上的第二高首秀）后，他们的流媒体播放量从 138,000 增加到 278,000，增加了一倍多本周，鞠躬第 14 号）。

再加上他们今天早上得到的关于《战争与条约》 获得 CMA 奖（年度声乐二人组）首次提名的好消息，对于已婚夫妇 Michael Trotter Jr. 和 Tanya Trotter 来说，这是非常美好的一周。 –安德鲁·安特伯格

如果您想要流媒体：舞蹈趋势复兴 18 岁蕾哈娜单曲

当粉丝们继续等待Rihanna 2016 年公告牌 200 强歌曲《Anti》的完整续集时，他们开始转向她的唱片的开头来解渴。得益于专业舞者Brett Sewell创造的病毒式 TikTok 舞蹈潮流，蕾哈娜 2005 年首张专辑中的第二首也是最后一首单曲《If It's Lovin' That You Want》在流媒体上取得了可观的收益。

根据 Luminate 的数据，《If It's Lovin' That You Want》在 Billboard Hot 100 中最高排名第 36 位，在 9 月 1 日至 5 日期间在美国的官方点播流媒体播放量已超过 251,000 次，比刚刚超过 172% 的增幅高达 172%。 8 月 25 日至 29 日期间有 92,000 次直播。 Sewell 的舞蹈充满了嘻哈风格，很快就在 TikTok 上占据了主导地位。自 8 月 25 日首次上传以来，他的原创视频已获得超过 820 万次观看和 110 万次点赞。 随附的 TikTok 声音目前拥有超过 141,900 个帖子。

十八年后，在《Pon De Replay》的阴影下度过了近二十年后，《如果是你想要的爱》似乎终于得到了应有的回报。 –凯尔·丹尼斯

TikTok 为 Tyla 的《Water》带来了流媒体收益的海啸

2023 年，各个流派的突破艺术家数量相当多，随着《Water》最新的令人瞠目结舌的流媒体收益，南非歌手兼舞者泰拉 (Tyla)希望将自己的名字添加到该名单中。

根据 Luminate 的数据，9 月 1 日至 5 日期间，艾拉·斯塔尔 (Ayra Starr) 协助的 amapiano 夏季热门歌曲《邻家女孩》(Girl Next Door) 的后续作品《水》(Water) 在美国官方点播流媒体播放量已超过 932,000 次，较去年同期增长了 198%。 8 月 25 日至 29 日期间，直播量超过 312,000 次。考虑到《Water》在 8 月 11 日至 17 日的整个跟踪周内发布了 121,000 条流媒体，这一增长更加令人印象深刻。

这首歌的官方现场表演编排催生了一种以战利品为中心的舞蹈趋势，迅速占领了 TikTok，导致该歌曲出现爆炸式增长。 Tyla 本人也积极鼓励和参与这一趋势，转发粉丝们为她的催眠舞蹈所做的最大努力——水瓶等等。 “Water”的官方 TikTok 声音目前拥有超过 49,300 个帖子。 Tyla 以这首歌及其编舞为特色的最火爆的视频在该平台上获得了 200 万个赞和超过 1740 万次观看。

由于官方音乐录影带即将推出，“Water”完全有能力继续成长为 Tyla 迄今为止最热门的全球热门歌曲。 – KD

; 本周公告牌排行榜上首次上榜的 10 位歌手：Buck Meek、Juju<3、Säje、Peakboy 等https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/billboard-charts-first-timers-buck-meek-saje-peakboy-1235407434/Xander Zellner Thu, 07 Sep 2023 15:46:15 +0000 Chart BeatMusicMusic News https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235407434 These acts are brand new to Billboard’s charts, dated Sept. 9.

Billboard的菜单中有 200 多个不同的每周排行榜，涵盖多种流派和格式。

虽然知名艺人经常在Billboard Hot 100歌曲排行榜和Billboard 200专辑排行榜（分别追踪本周最受欢迎的歌曲和专辑）上争夺一席之地，但崭露头角的艺术家通常会从特定流派的列表开始。

以下是首次出现在 9 月 9 日排行榜调查中的 10 位艺术家。

巴克·米克

这位 Big Thief 乐队的创作型歌手兼吉他手/和声歌手凭借他的新独奏唱片《 Haunted Mountain》 ，首次登上Billboard排行榜。据 Luminate 称，该专辑于 8 月 25 日通过 4AD 发行，在美国当前专辑销量榜上排名第 82 位，首周售出 1,000 张。这张专辑还帮助他在新晋艺术家排行榜上排名第 46 位。 《Haunted Mountain》是米克在《Big Thief》之外的第三张个人专辑，此前他于 2018 年发行了同名专辑，并于 2021 年发行了《Two Saviors》 。米克目前正在进行他的全球个人巡演的欧洲站，该巡演将持续到二月份。

自 2016 年首次亮相以来，Big Thief 在Billboard排行榜上创造了成功的历史。该乐队已在 Billboard 200 排行榜上上榜了三张专辑： UFOF （2019 年峰值第 142 名）、 Two Hands （2019 年第 113 名）和龙新暖山我相信你（第31期；2022）。后两张专辑进入了最佳另类专辑排行榜前十名，而《龙》则在美国/民谣专辑排行榜上排名第一。该乐队还在 Adult Alternative Airplay 上上榜了两首歌曲：“Certainty”（2021 年峰值第 34 名）和“Simulation Swarm”（2022 年第 18 名）。 《UFOF》和《Dragon》分别荣获 2020 年和 2023 年格莱美最佳另类音乐专辑奖。

朱朱<3

这位 18 岁的加州创作歌手（真名朱利安·佩雷斯）凭借其突破性的病毒歌曲“Wasted Summers”首次登上Billboard排行榜。这首忧郁的流行摇滚歌曲于 7 月 12 日发行，首次登上热门另类歌曲第 13 名、热门摇滚歌曲第 25 名、热门摇滚和另类歌曲第 32 名，在最近的跟踪周中获得了 280 万次美国流媒体播放量。

这首歌还包括 Juju<3 10 岁的妹妹 Lailah（她被认为是共同词曲作者）的声音，7 月份在 TikTok 上疯传。迄今为止，该歌曲的一部分已在该平台上超过234,000 个剪辑中使用（TikTok 活动不会直接贡献到Billboard的排行榜）。上个月， Billboard报道称 Juju<3 和经理 Peyton Miller 最近与 Indify 敲定了一项融资协议，并与 Good Boy Records 和 Stellar Trigger 合作。 “莱拉和我非常感激，甚至无法理解这个！！！”随后他在 TikTok 上发帖。

萨耶

这个声乐超级组合凭借其首张同名录音室专辑首次登上公告牌排行榜。该专辑于 8 月 25 日在 sajevoices 上发行，首次亮相就在当代爵士专辑中排名第二，在爵士专辑中排名第三，首周就获得了 2,000 张同等专辑单位的销量。由于所有这些单位都是传统专辑销量，该专辑在当前专辑销量排行榜上也排名第 47 位，在热门专辑销量排行榜上排名第 81 位。这张专辑帮助四重奏首次亮相，就在新兴艺术家排行榜上排名第 21 位。专辑中的一首歌曲“Desert Song”获得了 2021 年格莱美最佳编曲、器乐和声乐提名。

Säje 由 Sara Gazarek、Amanda Taylor、Johnaye Kendrick 和 Erin Bentlage 组成。所有四位艺术家都已经在团体之外建立了个人职业生涯。 Gazarek 已在Billboard爵士专辑排行榜上打入了五张个人专辑，其中包括前 10 名的《Dream In The Blue 》（2016 年排名第 10 名）和《Thirsty Ghost》 （2019 年排名第 3）。该乐队目前正在巡回演出以支持其首张专辑，演出日期定于 11 月。

巅峰男孩

这位韩国说唱歌手（真名权成焕）凭借在 V 的节日歌曲《Snow Flower》中的精彩亮相而登上Billboard排行榜。这首歌曲首次亮相就在世界数字歌曲排行榜上排名第 2 位，在所有流派数字歌曲销售排行榜上排名第 43 位，在最新的跟踪周内下载量达到 2,000 次。这首歌曲最初于 2020 年 12 月仅通过 Soundcloud 和 YouTube 限量发行，8 月 28 日与 V 的 2019 年歌曲《Scenery》和《Winter Bear》一起在数字下载和流媒体平台上广泛发行后首次亮相。这些曲目是在 V 即将于 9 月 8 日星期五发行的首张个人录音室专辑《Layover》之前发布的。 来自韩国仁川的 Peakboy 在他的职业生涯中发行了三张个人 EP： 《Portrait》 （2018 年）、 《Us》 （2019）和循环（2020）。

蒂科拉

这位法国说唱歌手（真名威廉·蒙达拉）凭借与戴夫合作的《Meridian》首次登上公告牌排行榜。这首歌曲于 8 月 25 日在 Neighborhood Recordings 发行，首次在全球排除排行榜上排名第 164 位。在美国以外的美国排行榜上，该歌曲已获得 940 万次流媒体播放量，这首歌在其他国家/地区也大受欢迎，首次亮相就在Billboard法国歌曲排行榜上排名第二，在卢森堡歌曲排行榜上排名第四，在瑞士歌曲排行榜上排名第七，在比利时歌曲排名第八。

Tiakola 也是嘻哈乐队 4Keus 的成员。 He released his debut solo studio album Mélo in May 2022.

SOG

The Colombian producer (whose name is an acronym for his full name, Santiago Orrego Gallego) reaches Billboard ’s charts for the first time under an artist billing thanks to his new collaboration with Blessd and Peso Pluma, “Ojos Azules.” The song, released Aug. 24 on JM World/Cigol/Warner Latina, debuts at No. 46 on the Hot Latin Songs chart, fueled in large part by 2.1 million US streams earned in its first full week of tracking. SOG has previously charted two songs on Hot Latin Songs as a producer: Ryan Castro's “Mujeriego” (No. 33 peak in 2022) and Castro and Peso Pluma's “Quema” (No. 21 peak in July). He also produced Blessd's “Instagram,” which reached No. 18 on Latin Rhythm Airplay and No. 47 on Latin Airplay.

Akiaura, LONOWN & STM

All three artists arrive on Billboard ’s charts with their collaboration “Sleepwalker.” The song, released June 30 via virtual memory404, debuts at No. 42 on the Hot Dance/Electronic Songs chart, powered by 790,000 official US streams earned in the latest tracking week. The song appears on Akiaura and LONOWN's latest EP, Ketamine Girl. TikTok has been a contributing factor to the song's growing profile, as a portion of the audio has been used in over 10,000 clips on the platform. Akiaura is an experimental electronic artist whose music is inspired by darkwave/underground basement sounds. LONOWN, who records phonk, ambient and trap music, has released one additional EP: Heaven Subculture in 2019. STM, who provides the vocals on “Sleepwalker,” has released several other solo EPs, including ELECTRONICA (2019), CHROMA (2022), and SPLIT (2022).

达博威

The American-born Thai rapper (real name Prinya Intachai) lands on Billboard ’s charts with his new track “POGO” featuring Mark B. The song, which he self-released Aug. 25, debuts at No. 8 on Latin Rhythm Digital Song Sales and No. 16 on Latin Digital Song Sales. DABOYWAY released his debut self-titled solo LP in 2020 on Def Jam Recordings Thailand. Outside of his solo work, he was a member of the Bangkok-based rap group Thaitanium.

Sydtherockerkid

The Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter arrives on Billboard ’s charts thanks to her featured appearance on HARBER's “Medicine.” The dance-pop anthem, released June 30 on Lowly, debuts at No. 31 on the Dance/Mix Show Airplay chart (up 105% in plays). Sydtherockerkid (real name Sydney Schmier) has only released one solo song on streaming services so far: “Bad Girl,” in May. She's also one-half of the pop duo Stereo Jane with her sister, Mia. The pair released their debut five-track EP Are We There Yet? last year. As for HARBER, the EDM artist had landed one song on Billboard ’s charts before this week: “More Than,” with Lexy Panterra, reached No. 21 on the Dance Club Songs chart in 2019.

Chris Canas

The Detroit-based artist debuts on Billboard ’s charts for the first time with his new LP Detroit . The set, released July 1, 2022, debuts at No. 12 on the Blues Albums chart. Canas released six other albums before Detroit : Shades of Blue (2002), C (2003), Sunshine (2004), Pure As Gold (2006), She's Breaking Me (2010) and Would You Mind (2020).

; What Is a Peptic Ulcer Disease?: Doctor Explains Condition Grounding Bruce Springsteen Tour https://www.billboard.com/music/rock/bruce-springsteen-what-is-peptic-ulcer-disease-doctor-explains-1235408109/Gil Kaufman Thu, 07 Sep 2023 15:38:52 +0000 MusicRockMusic NewsrockTouring https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235408109 The Boss and the E Street Band postponed the remainder of their Sept. shows as the rock legend gets treatment for the painful ailment.

Bruce Springsteen postponed the remainder of the E Street Band's September US shows on Wednesday (Sept. 6) after revealing to fans in a note on Instagram that he was receiving treatment for peptic ulcer disease. The 73-year-old rock icon apologized to the faithful for the scotching of the nine September dates — beginning tonight (Sept. 7) with a show in Syracuse, NY — which were slated to last through a Sept. 29 gig at Nationals Park in Washington.直流

Springsteen's post did not give any additional information on his medical issue, but Billboard reached out to Dr. Rudolph Bedford, a gastroenterologist at Providence Saint John's Health Center in Santa Monica, CA for more information on the painful, fairly common gastro condition.

Bedford, who does not have any first-hand knowledge of Springsteen's health and was speaking in general terms on peptic ulcer disease, says that it can cause “sever abdominal pain… to the point of doubling you over.” He says that the condition is caused by an imbalance in the protective lining of the stomach. “The stomach is full of acid and whenever something in that acid destroys the protective lining the nerves in the stomach wall become inflamed and cause severe pain,” Bedford says.

The doctor adds there are several things that might cause the condition, most notably taking anti-inflammatory drugs such as Motrin or Aleve on an empty stomach, or other medications that can cause irritation when taken on an empty stomach.

有关的

Bruce Springsteen Postpones All September Shows as He's Treated for Peptic Ulcer…

09/07/2023

Another possible cause is a helicobacter pylori infection, which is a bacterial infection in your stomach that Bedford says many people acquire at an early age for reasons that are not always clear; the bacteria sets up in the stomach at an early age and can cause inflammation of the stomach lining leading to ulceration. In the case of the latter, there is no way to know if the infection will cause medical issues later in life and children at not typically tested for it.

Springsteen appears to be a hale and hearty septuagenarian and Bedford says age is not the likeliest factor for the disease. “It can happen to anyone,” he says, adding the caveat that someone the Boss' age is likely on a more medications than someone who is younger. “I would certainly think he'd be popping antacids and acid reducing meds all day,” Bedford says of the expected treatment.

Though it varies from person-to-person, “significant healing” typically occurs within a week or so; if the cause is H. pylori, Bedford says it could require a dose of antibiotics and acid-reducing meds that would clear the disease up within a week or two. “In this day and age, surgery is exceedingly rare and medications works quite well,” he says of the less typical, more intense surgical intervention.

; Alternative Airplay Chart's 35th Anniversary: Foo Fighters Remain No. 1 Act, 'Monsters' New Top Song https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/alternative-airplay-chart-35th-anniversary-foo-fighters-all-time-low-rule-1235408126/Kevin Rutherford Thu, 07 Sep 2023 15:33:20 +0000 Chart BeatMusicMusic Newsrock https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235408126 The band has reigned as the top act on each anniversary recap since 2013.

The first two times Billboard celebrated the Alternative Airplay chart's anniversary, Foo Fighters reigned as the top act, while Muse 's “Uprising” claimed top song honors, both in 2013 (for the survey's 25th year ) and 2018 ( 30th ).

Some things don't change. As Billboard reveals the updated Greatest of All Time 35th-anniversary recap of Alternative Airplay – which began in the issue dated Sept. 10, 1988 – it's Foo Fighters who again rank above the rest as the tally's top act.

But 35 years on, a new title has taken the throne as top song: All Time Low 's “Monsters” featuring blackbear .

Upon the list's latest milestone, Billboard recognizes the Alternative Airplay chart's top 100 songs and top 100 artists, from its September 1988 inception through September 2023. (See chart methodology below.)

Foos Fight to Top Artist Chart Again

Foo Fighters remain in a league of their own as Alternative Airplay's No. 1 act over the chart's first 35 years.

Mind you, the band's old rival, Red Hot Chili Peppers , didn't make it easy. The Chili Peppers remain at No. 2 behind the Foos, an order that's persisted since the 25th-anniversary ranking.

Despite no movement at the top, neither band rested on its laurels between years 30 and 35. The Dave Grohl -fronted Foo Fighters released Medicine at Midnight in 2021, an album that spurred four Alternative Airplay top 10s. Earlier this year, the rockers followed with But Here We Are, their first following the death of longtime drummer Taylor Hawkins in 2022. Already the Foos have notched their first No. 1, “Rescued,” since 2014.

Anthony Kiedis and Red Hot Chili Peppers, meanwhile, released two albums, Unlimited Love and Return of the Dream Canteen in 2022, LPs that christened the return of guitarist John Frusciante . The result was a pair of No. 1 songs in “Black Summer” and “Tippa My Tongue,” extending the band's record for the most chart-toppers – 15 – in the ranking's history.

It's not just the top two that remain the same. The top five acts for the 35th anniversary refresh are in the positions that they held in 2018. To recap: Green Day at No. 3 (three chart appearances since the 30th, including the No. 1 “Oh Yeah!” in 2020), Linkin Park at No. 4 (one No. 1 in the Meteora outtake “Lost,” released in 2023 as part of the album's 20th-birthday reissue) and U2 at No. 5 (no chart appearances, but Bono and Co. still hold the record for the most Alternative Airplay appearances: 42).

The top 10, however, sees some movement. Weezer moves up to No. 6, from No. 9, from, in large part, a streak of four No. 1s since 2020 that's still intact as of this writing, while Imagine Dragons shoot into the top 10 at No. 7, from No. 16, via a pair of leaders in 2021-22. REM , Cage the Elephant and Pearl Jam round out the top 10, with Cage the Elephant also joining the top 10 for the first time, up from No. 15.

The recap's top debuting act is one that, perhaps surprisingly, wasn't among the top 100 in 2018: Panic! at the Disco , the Brendon Urie -led outfit that first appeared on Alternative Airplay in 2006. In 2018, the seeds for a Panic! renaissance had begun to be sown with the band's first Alternative Airplay No. 1 in “Say Amen (Saturday Night).” After that anniversary, the act ruled the chart for 16 weeks with “High Hopes” and followed with the three-week leader “Viva Las Vengeance” in 2022.

Meanwhile, for the first time, two solo women appear among the chart's top 100 artists. Alanis Morissette , who ranked at No. 62 on the 30th anniversary list, places at No. 67, joined by Billie Eilish , who debuts at No. 93. One of the format's breakout stars since the last anniversary, Eilish has already racked up four No. 1s, surpassing Morissette for the most rulers by a solo woman – or any soloist – in the ranking's history.

The 30th anniversary featured eight women or acts either fronted or co-fronted by women in the top 100. For the 35th, that number jumps to 11, with Eilish, Grouplove and Paramore joining in. The Cranberries lead all such acts at No. 62.

All Time Low's 'Monsters' Roars to No. 1

Most weeks ever on the chart. Third-most weeks at No. 1.

Yeah, it makes sense that All Time Low's “Monsters” featuring blackbear now reigns as the all-time biggest song in the Alternative Airplay chart's history.

When “Monsters” debuted at No. 36 on the May 30, 2020-dated ranking amid the early months of the COVID-19 pandemic, it marked All Time Low's first Alternative Airplay appearance despite nearly a decade-and-a-half of Billboard chart entries; even to that point with five top 10 albums on the Billboard 200, the rockers weren't a household name on radio, their biggest airplay hit being the No. 13-peaking “Good Times” on Adult Pop Airplay in 2017.

But “Monsters” persisted, riding a wave of pop-punk throwbacks and revivalism to No. 1 on Alternative Airplay that September. It remained there for 18 nonconsecutive weeks, ultimately tying Foo Fighters' “The Pretender” for the third-longest rule ever.

Here's the thing, though: It wasn't done. The song spent its final week at No. 1 on Jan. 23, 2021, and didn't fall off the survey until a tick over a year later, through the chart dated Jan. 29, 2022. During that span, continued radio airplay kept the song anywhere between Nos. 2 and 9 – in fact, after dropping to No. 9 in June 2021, it rebounded as high as No. 3 that September.

In all, “Monsters” maintained on Alternative Airplay for 88 weeks, 12 more than its closest competitor (more on it in a moment). And even now, the song remains within the top 10 of recurrent airplay at the format.

That closest challenger? Another newcomer to the all-time list's top 100. Lovelytheband 's “Broken” ranks at No. 2 following a stretch that includes nine weeks at No. 1 in 2018 and 76 total weeks on the chart. It spurred a career for the trio that has included four additional top 10s, including the No. 3-peaking “Sail Away” earlier this year, and a No. 78 debut on the all-time artists survey.

Muse's “Uprising,” the previous recap's No. 1, is pushed to No. 3 on the Alternative Airplay chart's top songs retrospective, while the previous Nos. 2 and 3 tracks, Rise Against 's “Savior” and Portugal. The Man 's “Feel It Still,” drop to Nos. 4 and 5, respectively. The latter remains in possession of the chart's longest No. 1 run – 20 weeks – while “Savior” is still the top-ranking song all-time that never reached No. 1 on a weekly ranking, peaking at No. 3 in 2009.

The other song to join the top 10 since the 30th anniversary is the aforementioned “High Hopes” by Panic! at the Disco, at No. 9 following 16 weeks at No. 1 and 49 total frames on the survey.

Billboard's Greatest of All Time 35th Anniversary Alternative Airplay Songs & Artists rankings are based on weekly performance on the radio airplay-based Alternative Airplay chart (from its Sept. 10, 1988, inception through Sept. 2, 2023). Songs are ranked based on an inverse point system, with weeks at No. 1 earning the greatest value and weeks at lower spots earning the least. Due to changes in chart methodology over the years, eras are weighted differently to account for chart turnover rates over various periods. Artists are ranked based on a formula blending performance, as outlined above, of all their Alternative Airplay chart entries.

; Will Doja Cat End Both Country's Reign and Hip-Hop's Top-Spot Drought on the Hot 100? https://www.billboard.com/pro/doja-cat-paint-the-town-red-first-rap-number-one-hit-2023/Andrew Unterberger Thu, 07 Sep 2023 15:18:41 +0000 Chart BeatMusicThe Contenders https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235408215 In this week’s The Contenders, the singer-rapper's latest single could shake things up at the chart’s apex.  

The Contenders is a midweek column that looks at artists aiming for the top of the Billboard charts, and the strategies behind their efforts. This week (for the upcoming charts dated Sept. 16), the last four singles to top the Billboard Hot 100 have all been led by country artists – and white guys – but both streaks may be coming to an end with the rise of a returning pop-rap star's latest.

Doja Cat, “Paint the Town Red” (Kemosabe/RCA) : It feels almost quaint in 2023: A big pop release that makes a solid debut, and climbs from there. Doja Cat 's “Paint the Town Red” entered at a good-not-great No. 15 on the Hot 100 in August, but it has only grown since then, jumping into the top five last week and hitting a new peak of No. 3 this week. With the song still gaining on all three Hot 100 component charts – Streaming Songs (up 3-2 this week), Digital Song Sales (11-6) and Radio Songs (24-17) — it should be a threat to take the top spot on next week's chart.

If it does, it will be notable for reasons beyond becoming Doja Cat's second career Hot 100-topper, following 2020's “Say So” featuring Nicki Minaj. It would be the first non-country No. 1 on the chart since Jung Kook's Latto-featuring “Seven” debuted atop the chart dated July 29, seven weeks earlier. In the time since, a record four consecutive country songs (defined as songs deemed eligible for Billboard's Hot Country Songs ranking) have claimed the top spot: Morgan Wallen's “Last Night,” Jason Aldean's “Try That in a Small Town,” Oliver Anthony Music's “Rich Men North of Richmond,” and this week's new No. 1, Zach Bryan's “I Remember Everything,” featuring Kacey Musgraves.

A much longer streak would also be ended if “Paint the Town Red” hits No. 1: It's now been 55 weeks since a rap song last ruled the Hot 100 (“Super Freaky Girl,” by Doja Cat's “Say So” co-star Nicki Minaj), the longest such run since the turn of the century. While Doja's rap bona fides have long been the subject of (often ridiculous) internet debate as she crosses further into the top 40 world, “Paint” has scaled Billboard'sHot Rap Songs chart – currently sitting at No. 1 there for a second week – meaning the genre's Hot 100 drought may soon be over.

Zach Bryan feat. Kacey Musgraves, “I Remember Everything” (Belting Bronco/Warner) : The No. 1 debut that few saw coming last week should not be due for a particularly huge drop off in its second week. Zach Bryan 's “I Remember Everything,” featuring Kacey Musgraves , has been holding fairly strong on both streaming (still No. 1 on Apple Music's daily charts and No. 2 on Spotify) and sales (in the top five on iTunes) — and without any major debuts or gainers (aside from Doja) coming from behind it, it should still be in contention for one of the Hot 100's top few spots this week.

The question for “Everything” will be how much radio embraces it. Bryan's American Heartbreak Hot 100 top 10 hit “Something in the Orange” ultimately elbowed its way into the top 20 on Country Airplay, but Bryan's stardom has mostly come independently of radio and the Nashville machine, and it's not clear yet if “I Remember Everything” will prove an exception. So far, the song is nearing the Country Airplay chart, with 272,000 audience impressions at the format Sept. 1-4, according to Luminate, up from 175,000 in its entire first week.

Luke Combs, “Fast Car” (River House/Columbia Nashville/Columbia) : It's probably an overstatement to say that you have to feel for Luke Combs – when he first decided to cover Tracy Chapman's alt-folk classic “Fast Car,” he probably never expected to get anywhere near the top spot of the Hot 100 with it. At this point, though, the song has now spent eight weeks idling at No. 2, while seemingly every other male country singer-songwriter speeds just ahead of him – and it's starting to look like it might not ever get there himself.

“Fast Car” does finally lead the Radio Songs chart this week – Combs' first No. 1 on that listing – while still hanging in the top 10 of Digital Song Sales and Streaming Songs. But “Car” seems to have stalled on all three component charts, so if Doja zooms by it this week, it might be tough for it to catch up again.

IN THE MIX

Taylor Swift, “Cruel Summer” (Republic): Labor Day Weekend came and went without any final promotional efforts for Taylor Swift 's “Cruel Summer,” which remains at No. 4 on the Hot 100 this week, after reaching No. 3, but is nearing its peak at radio and might not be able to hold in streaming and sales to remain a true No. 1 contender for much longer. All that remains now is the potential boost from the already blockbuster-certified Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour movie – but with that film not due still for over a month, it's likely that “Summer” will have cooled off too much by then anyway.

Nicki Minaj, “Last Time I Saw You” (Young Money/Republic) : Speaking of Minaj : It's likely that she will have the week's best Hot 100 bow with her much-hyped new single “Last Time I Saw You.” The song got off to a typically strong start in sales and streaming upon its Friday (Sept. 1) debut, but has already faded pretty quickly on the daily Spotify and Apple charts. Given the song's top 40-friendly crossover sound, though, it might not be too long before radio starts picking up the slack there.
